fusionlibrary
  • fusionlibrary.data
  • View page source

fusionlibrary.dataïƒ

This file contains the data for the different modalities and the different fusion methods. The data are used to load the data and create the dataloader objects for training and validation.

Functions

downsample_img_batch(imgs,Â output_size)

Downsamples a batch of images to a specified size.

get_data_module(fusion_model,Â params[,Â ...])

Gets the data module for the specified modality and fusion type.

Classes

CustomDataModule(params,Â modality_type,Â ...)

Custom pytorch lightning datamodule class for the different modalities.

CustomDataset(pred_features,Â labels)

Custom dataset class for multimodal data.

GraphDataModule(params,Â modality_type,Â ...)

Custom pytorch lightning datamodule class for the different modalities with graph data structure.

KFoldDataModule(params,Â modality_type,Â ...)

Custom pytorch lightning datamodule class for the different modalities with k-fold cross validation

KFoldGraphDataModule(params,Â modality_type,Â ...)

Custom pytorch lightning datamodule class for the different modalities with graph data structure and k-fold cross validation

LoadDatasets(sources[,Â img_downsample_dims])

Class for loading the different datasets for the different modalities.
class CustomDataModule(params, modality_type, sources, batch_size, subspace_method=None, image_downsample_size=None, layer_mods=None, max_epochs=1000)[source]ïƒ

Bases: LightningDataModule

Custom pytorch lightning datamodule class for the different modalities.

sourcesïƒ

List of source csv files.

Type:

list

image_downsample_sizeïƒ

Size to downsample the images to (height, width, depth) or (height, width) for 2D images.

Type:

tuple

modality_methodsïƒ

Dictionary of methods for loading the different modalities.

Type:

dict

modality_typeïƒ

Type of modality (tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img).

Type:

str

batch_sizeïƒ

Batch size (default 8).

Type:

int

test_sizeïƒ

Fraction of data to use for testing (default 0.2).

Type:

float

pred_typeïƒ

Prediction type (binary, multiclass, regression).

Type:

str

multiclass_dimsïƒ

Number of classes for multiclass prediction (default None).

Type:

int

subspace_methodïƒ

Subspace method class (default None) (only for subspace methods).

Type:

class

layer_modsïƒ

Dictionary of layer modifications to make to the subspace method. (default None)

Type:

dict

max_epochsïƒ

Maximum number of epochs to train subspace methods for. (default 1000)

Type:

int

datasetïƒ

Tensor of predictive features.

Type:

tensor

data_dimsïƒ

List of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim]

Type:

list

train_datasetïƒ

Tensor of predictive features for training.

Type:

tensor

test_datasetïƒ

Tensor of predictive features for testing.

Type:

tensor

__init__(params, modality_type, sources, batch_size, subspace_method=None, image_downsample_size=None, layer_mods=None, max_epochs=1000)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • modality_type (str) â€“ Type of modality (tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img).

  • sources (list) â€“ List of source csv files.

  • batch_size (int) â€“ Batch size (default 8).

  • subspace_method (class) â€“ Subspace method class (default None) (only for subspace methods).

  • image_downsample_size (tuple) â€“ Size to downsample the images to (height, width, depth) or (height, width) for 2D images. None if not downsampling. (default None)

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications to make to the subspace method. (default None)

  • max_epochs (int) â€“ Maximum number of epochs to train subspace methods for. (default 1000)

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If modality_type is not one of the following: tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img.

prepare_data()[source]ïƒ

Loads the data with LoadDatasets class

Returns:

  • dataset (tensor) â€“ Tensor of predictive features.

  • data_dims (list) â€“ List of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim] i.e. [None, None, [100, 100, 100]] for image only (image dimensions 100 x 100 x 100) i.e. [8, 32, None] for tabular1 and tabular2 (tabular1 has 8 features, tabular2 has 32 features), and no image

setup()[source]ïƒ

Splits the data into train and test sets, and runs the subspace method if specified

Returns:

  • train_dataloader (dataloader) â€“ Dataloader for training.

  • val_dataloader (dataloader) â€“ Dataloader for validation.

train_dataloader()[source]ïƒ

Returns the dataloader for training.

Returns:

dataloader â€“ Dataloader for training.

Return type:

dataloader

Returns the dataloader for validation.

Returns:

dataloader â€“ Dataloader for validation.

Return type:

dataloader

class CustomDataset(pred_features, labels)[source]ïƒ

Bases: Dataset

Custom dataset class for multimodal data.

pred_featuresïƒ

List of tensors or tensor of predictive features (i.e. tabular or image data without labels).

Type:

list or tensor

labelsïƒ

Dataframe of labels (column name must be â€œpred_labelâ€).

Type:

dataframe

__len__()[source]ïƒ

Returns the length of the dataset.

__getitem__(idx)[source]ïƒ

Returns the item at the specified index.

__init__(pred_features, labels)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • pred_features (list or tensor) â€“ List of tensors or tensor of predictive features (i.e. tabular or image data without labels).

  • labels (dataframe) â€“ Dataframe of labels (column name must be â€œpred_labelâ€).

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If pred_features is not a list or tensor.

__init__(params, modality_type, sources, graph_creation_method, image_downsample_size=None, layer_mods=None)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • modality_type (str) â€“ Type of modality (tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img).

  • sources (list) â€“ List of source csv files.

  • graph_creation_method (class) â€“ Graph creation method class.

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications to make to the graph maker method.

__init__(params, modality_type, sources, batch_size, subspace_method=None, image_downsample_size=None, layer_mods=None, max_epochs=1000)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • modality_type (str) â€“ Type of modality (tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img).

  • sources (list) â€“ List of source csv files.

  • batch_size (int) â€“ Batch size (default 8).

  • subspace_method (class) â€“ Subspace method class (default None) (only for subspace methods).

  • max_epochs (int) â€“ Maximum number of epochs to train subspace methods for. (default 1000)

  • image_downsample_size (tuple) â€“ Size to downsample the images to (height, width, depth) or (height, width) for 2D images. None if not downsampling. (default None)

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications to make to the subspace method.

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If modality_type is not one of the following: tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img.

  • modality_type (str) â€“ Type of modality (tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img).

  • graph_creation_method (class) â€“ Graph creation method class.

  • image_downsample_size (tuple) â€“ Size to downsample the images to (height, width, depth) or (height, width) for 2D images. None if not downsampling. (default None)

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications to make to the graph maker method.

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If modality_type is not one of the following: tabular1, tabular2, img, both_tab, tab_img.

class LoadDatasets(sources, img_downsample_dims=None)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Class for loading the different datasets for the different modalities.

tabular1_sourceïƒ

Source csv file for tabular1 data.

Type:

str

tabular2_sourceïƒ

Source csv file for tabular2 data.

Type:

str

img_sourceïƒ

Source torch file for image data.

Type:

str

image_downsample_sizeïƒ

Size to downsample the images to (height, width, depth).

Type:

tuple

load_tabular1()[source]ïƒ

Loads the tabular1-only dataset.

load_tabular2()[source]ïƒ

Loads the tabular2-only dataset.

load_img()[source]ïƒ

Loads the image-only dataset.

load_both_tabular()[source]ïƒ

Loads the tabular1 and tabular2 multimodal dataset.

load_tab_and_img()[source]ïƒ

Loads the tabular1 and image multimodal dataset.

__init__(sources, img_downsample_dims=None)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • sources (list) â€“ List of source csv files. [tabular1_source, tabular2_source, img_source]

  • img_downsample_dims (tuple) â€“ Size to downsample the images to (height, width, depth) or (height, width) for 2D images. None if not downsampling. (default None)

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If sources is not a list.

load_both_tabular()[source]ïƒ

Loads the tabular1 and tabular2 multimodal dataset

Returns:

  • dataset (tensor) (tensor of predictive features)

  • data_dims (list) (list of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim]) â€“ i.e. [None, None, [100, 100, 100]] for image only (image dimensions 100 x 100 x 100) i.e. [8, 32, None] for tabular1 and tabular2 (tabular1 has 8 features, tabular2 has 32 features), and no image

load_img()[source]ïƒ

Loads the image-only dataset

Returns:

  • dataset (tensor) (tensor of predictive features)

  • data_dims (list) (list of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim]) â€“ i.e. [None, None, [100, 100, 100]] for image only (image dimensions 100 x 100 x 100) i.e. [8, 32, None] for tabular1 and tabular2 (tabular1 has 8 features, tabular2 has 32 features), and no image

Loads the tabular1 and image multimodal dataset.

Returns:

  • dataset (tensor) (tensor of predictive features)

  • data_dims (list) (list of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim]) â€“ i.e. [None, None, [100, 100, 100]] for image only (image dimensions 100 x 100 x 100) i.e. [8, 32, None] for tabular1 and tabular2 (tabular1 has 8 features, tabular2 has 32 features), and no image

Loads the tabular1-only dataset

Returns:

  • dataset (tensor) (tensor of predictive features)

  • data_dims (list) (list of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim]) â€“ i.e. [None, None, [100, 100, 100]] for image only (image dimensions 100 x 100 x 100) i.e. [8, 32, None] for tabular1 and tabular2 (tabular1 has 8 features, tabular2 has 32 features), and no image

load_tabular2()[source]ïƒ

Loads the tabular2-only dataset

Returns:

  • dataset (tensor) (tensor of predictive features)

  • data_dims (list) (list of data dimensions [mod1_dim, mod2_dim, img_dim]) â€“ i.e. [None, None, [100, 100, 100]] for image only (image dimensions 100 x 100 x 100) i.e. [8, 32, None] for tabular1 and tabular2 (tabular1 has 8 features, tabular2 has 32 features), and no image

downsample_img_batch(imgs, output_size)[source]ïƒ

Downsamples a batch of images to a specified size.

Parameters:

  • imgs (array-like) â€“ Batch of images. Shape (batch_size, channels, height, width) or (batch_size, channels, height, width, depth) for 3D images.

  • output_size (tuple) â€“ Size to downsample the images to (height, width) or (height, width, depth) for 3D images. Do not put the batch_size dimension in the tuple. If None, no downsampling is performed

Returns:

downsampled_img â€“ Downsampled image.

Return type:

array-like

get_data_module(fusion_model, params, batch_size=8, image_downsample_size=None, layer_mods=None, max_epochs=1000)[source]ïƒ

Gets the data module for the specified modality and fusion type.

Parameters:

  • fusion_model (class) â€“ Fusion model class.

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • batch_size (int) â€“ Batch size (default 8).

  • image_downsample_size (list) â€“ List of image dimensions to downsample to (default None).

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications (default None).

Returns:

dm â€“ Datamodule for the specified fusion method.

Return type:

datamodule
